info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 5 at 4:46PM EDT until April 6 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following county, Stark.
* WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 441 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported that flooding from earlier today has begun receding. However, streams and creeks are running high with areas of standing water persisting in poor-drainage areas. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Canton, Massillon, Green, North Canton, Louisville, Hartville, Brewster, Navarre, East Sparta, Wilmot, Canal Fulton, East Canton, Beach City, Meyers Lake, Hills And Dales, Perry Heights, Greentown, Uniontown and North Lawrence. - At 400 PM EDT, a river gauge indicated that Sandy Creek in Waynesburg was at 7.2 feet and rising. Flood stage is 8.0 feet. The creek is expected to crest around 8.0 feet this evening before falling.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT
